subsection.subsectiontext: If a regional manager, district manager or forest officer considers it necessary or desirable to ensure that timber being transported under subsection (1) is delivered to the scale site and scaled, the manager or officer may impose conditions on the transportation of the timber.

In respect of timber transported by water, a condition imposed under subsection (2) may, without limiting the conditions that may be imposed, require the person to make a report to the regional manager, district manager or forest officer, in the form and manner required by the manager or officer, showing

paragraph.paragraphtext: the amount of timber that was shipped,
the amount of timber that was scaled, and
the bundle tag numbers cross-referenced with the information required under section 10 and in scale returns.

subsection.subsectiontext: When timber is being transported, the following persons must ensure that the written record required by this section is accurately completed, and copies of the written record are retained and remitted as directed by a forest officer:

paragraph.paragraphtext: the holder of the timber mark that is applied to the timber;
the receiver of the timber or the operator of the scale site to which the timber is being transported;
the holder of the scaled timber brand and, if applicable, the marine log brand that is applied to the timber.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who transports timber in British Columbia, or causes timber to be transported in British Columbia, whether the timber was harvested at a place within or outside of British Columbia, must, at all times, have in his or her possession a written record of the timber being transported.
